Amendment Scope Enrolment Description.name: Amendment Scope Enrolment Description
Amendment Scope Enrolment Description.definition:
CNEW
For review purpose, see definition of the controlled terminology below
The enrollment description as to whether the amendment scope applies globally, locally, or per cohort across the trial.
Amendment Scope Enrolment Description.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: Statement
Concept: CNEW

ct.preferred_term: Approximate Enrolled At Time of Sponsor Approval Scope
ct.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the responses for the approximate enrollment at time of sponsor approval scope within the ICH M11 Protocol model.
Covering or affecting the whole of a system.
Covering or affecting a portion of the system.
Covering or affecting a cohort of individuals.

yes, reuse for each Investigational Product

Enter Not applicable.name: Enter Not applicable
Enter Not applicable.definition:
CNEW
For review purpose, see definition of the controlled terminology below
A narrative representation of the comparator against which the study intervention is evaluated.
Enter Not applicable.conformance: Conditional : if there is a nonproprietary name or INN or Not applicable
Enter Not applicable.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: Row title; Sponsor Protocol Identifier
Concept: CNEW

Nonproprietary name 5.name: Nonproprietary name 5
Nonproprietary name 5.definition:
C97054
For review purpose, see definition of the controlled terminology below
Drug name that is not protected by a trademark, usually descriptive of its chemical structure. (ICH E2B)
Nonproprietary name 5.conformance: Conditional: if there is a Nonproprietary name
Nonproprietary name 5.value: Use for example WHO INN, USAN, JAN, XEVMPD
Nonproprietary name 5.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: Row title; Control Description; Sponsor Protocol Identifier
Concept: C97054
Nonproprietary name 5.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each nonproprietary name used as control

INN 6.name: INN 6
INN 6.definition:
C142585
For review purpose, see definition of the controlled terminology below
A unique name that is globally recognised and public property, which identifies pharmaceutical substances or active pharmaceutical ingredients. (After WHO)
INN 6.conformance: Conditional:  if there is an INN
INN 6.value: or use for example WHO INN, USAN, JAN, XEVMPD
INN 6.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: Row title; Control Description; Protocol Identifier
Concept: C142585
INN 6.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each INN used as control

Secondary Objective X.name: Secondary Objective X
Secondary Objective X.definition:
C85827
For review purpose, see definition of the controlled terminology below
The secondary reason for performing a study in terms of the scientific questions to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.
Secondary Objective X.cardinality: One to one; Table of Contents Number 3.2.X, One to Estimand Characteristic Table, Secondary Objective X, Protocol Identifier
Secondary Objective X.value: Text and unique integer which is same as Level 3 number for the section.
Secondary Objective X.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: 3.2.X Secondary Objective, Estimand Characteristics table
Concept: C85827
Secondary Objective X.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each numbered secondary objective.

Enter Table of Estimand Characteristics.name: Enter Table of Estimand Characteristics including Endpoint at a minimum
Enter Table of Estimand Characteristics.guidance: {If a Secondary Objective has been entered: <Enter Table of Estimand Characteristics>} including Endpoint at a minimum}

Enter Table of Estimand Characteristics.business_rules:
Value Allowed: No
Relationship: 3 3.2 Secondary Objective(s) and associated Estimand(s)
Concept: Heading
Enter Table of Estimand Characteristics.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each numbered secondary objective.

Population 7.name: Population 7
Population 7.definition:
C70833
For review purpose, see definition of the controlled terminology below
The population of patients targeted by the clinical question. This will be represented by the entire trial population, a subgroup defined by a particular characteristic measured at baseline, or a principal stratum defined by the occurrence (or non-occurrence, depending on context) of a specific intercurrent event.
Population 7.guidance: List of key characteristics, such as demographic characteristics (e.g. age, sex) and clinical characteristics (e.g. prior therapies, symptoms, severity, biomarker status)
Population 7.conformance: Conditional: If there is a population for Secondary
Population 7.cardinality: One to Row Heading, One to Secondary Objective Table, Secondary Objective X, Protocol Identifier
Population 7.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: Row Heading, Description; Estimand Characteristics, 
Concept: C70833
Population 7.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each numbered secondary objective.

Treatment 8.name: Treatment 8
Treatment 8.definition:
C49236
For review purpose, see definition of the controlled terminology below
The treatment condition of interest and, as appropriate, the alternative treatment condition to which comparison will be made (referred to as “treatment” through the remainder of this document). These might be individual interventions, combinations of interventions administered concurrently, e.g. as add-on to standard of care, or might consist of an overall regimen involving a complex sequence of interventions.
Treatment 8.guidance: List of key aspects of treatment regimens in each study group, including at least investigational agents, dosage, and administration route
Treatment 8.conformance: Conditional: If there is a population for Secondary
Treatment 8.cardinality: One to Row Heading, One to Secondary Objective Table, Project Identifier
Treatment 8.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: Row Heading, Description; Estimand Characteristics, 
Concept: C49236
Treatment 8.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each numbered secondary objective.

Endpoint 9.name: Endpoint 9
Endpoint 9.definition:
C25212

For review purpose, see definition of the controlled terminology below
The variable to be obtained for each patient that is required to address the clinical question. The specification of the variable might include whether the patient experiences an intercurrent event
Endpoint 9.guidance: List of key characteristics, such as demographic characteristics (e.g. age, sex) and clinical characteristics (e.g. prior therapies, symptoms, severity, biomarker status)
Endpoint 9.cardinality: One to Row Heading, One to Secondary Objective Table, Project Identifier
Endpoint 9.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: Row Heading, Description; Table Estimand Characteristics, Secondary (1…n) Estimand; Concept: C25212
Endpoint 9.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each numbered secondary objective.

Concept: C188853

Intercurrent Event Strategy.name: Intercurrent Event Strategy
Intercurrent Event Strategy.definition:
C188857
For review purpose, see definition of the controlled terminology below
A textual description of the planned strategy to address intercurrent events.
Intercurrent Event Strategy.guidance: Description of the strategy to address the intercurrent event (e.g. a treatment policy strategy); cross-reference the justification in Section 4. If there is >1 intercurrent event for an objective, add additional intercurrent event rows
Intercurrent Event Strategy.conformance: Conditional: If there is one or more other intercurrent events.
Intercurrent Event Strategy.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: Row Heading Intercurrent Event, Description
Concept: C188857
Intercurrent Event Strategy.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each intercurrent event

Concept: Universal text

-.guidance: Add criteria as needed. Consider numbering the criteria sequentially.
-.value: # is an integer <criterion identifier> unique number and not replaceable
-.business_rules:

Concept: Sequential number
-.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each inclusion criterion

Inclusion Criterion.name: Inclusion Criterion
Inclusion Criterion.definition:
C25532 
For review purpose, see definition of the controlled terminology below
The criteria in a protocol that prospective subjects must meet to be eligible for participation in a study.
Inclusion Criterion.guidance: Add criteria as needed. Consider numbering the criteria sequentially
Inclusion Criterion.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: to Number #, 5.2 Inclusion Criteria
Concept: C25532
Inclusion Criterion.repeating: Yes, number consecutively, repeatable for each inclusion criteria, if deleted do not replace, do not duplicate

An individual who meets any of the follo.name: An individual who meets any of the following criteria will be excluded from participation in this trial
An individual who meets any of the follo.value: An individual who meets any of the following criteria will be excluded from participation in this trial:
An individual who meets any of the follo.business_rules:
Value Allowed: No
Relationship: 5.3 Exclusion Criteria, 5 TRIAL POPULATION and Table of Contents
Concept: Universal text

- 16.guidance: Add criteria as needed.  Consider numbering the criteria sequentially
- 16.value: # is an identifier <criterion identifier> unique number and not replaceable
- 16.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: 5.3 Exclusion Criteria
Concept: Sequential number
- 16.repeating: Yes. number consecutively, repeatable for each exclusion criteria, if deleted do not replace, do not duplicate

Exclusion Criterion.definition:
C25370
For review purpose, see definition of the controlled terminology below
List of characteristics in a protocol, any one of which excludes a potential subject from participation in a study. (CDISC glossary)
Exclusion Criterion.guidance: Add criteria as needed. Consider numbering the criteria sequentially
Exclusion Criterion.business_rules:
Value Allowed: Yes
Relationship: to Number #, 5.3 Exclusion Criteria
Concept: C25370
